ygData.subject: Re: Alcohol, instruments, and hunting grounds
ygData.msgSnippet: ... You right click on it while it is in your inventory. I don t remember if it HAS to be in your main inventory or if it can be in a container. ... You have
ygData.messageBody:
>From: "Michal Hobson" <given@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: "EQBards" <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Subject: [eqbards] Alcohol, instruments, and hunting grounds
>Date: Thu, 27 May 1999 07:24:37 -0500
>
>Hail fellow Bards,
>
>I have several rather innane questions this morning. First of all, how
>exactly do you drink the alcohol you purchase? I know it is a silly
>question but I have never tried before.

You right click on it while it is in your inventory. I don't remember if it
HAS to be in your main inventory or if it can be in a container.


>Secondly, being lvl 5, I just got my Selo's song and purchased a drum.
>However, every time I equip the drum and attempt to play the song, it tells
>me to stick to singing until I learn the instrument. Is it a thing you can
>practice at the guild? The missed note got me stomped by a hill giant
>yesterday. Do they always attack on sight?
>

You have to go to your guild and train at least 1 point into percussion.
Matter of fact, ANY time you get a new skill (dual-wield, strings, dodge,
etc..) you'll want to do this. And yes, homers KOS.


>Thirdly, where is a good place to hunt at lvl 5-10? I tried to go to the
>second zone out of Freeport and all there was were Kodiaks, young Kodiaks,
>and of course my friend the giant.
>

Well there are plenty of things to hunt in either of the commons zones, but
both hold some potentially lethal creatures (griffons come to mind
immediately). You could also try North Ro. I also found that Kithicor was a
great place to hunt if you go past the wall.

>Bear with us newbies, I realize that most of the people that respond on
>this list are anywhere from lvl 18-50, but you have the stories and the
>knowledge to pass down through your posts. Its very much like an extension
>of the game. That is what we as bard's do for a living!
>

Everyone was a newbie at least once and has needed help at one time or
another! =)

Sartori D'Elsiraad
Bard of Kelethin of the 11th Chorus
Veeshan
